chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
f: R -> R
b: R
a: R
n: nat
x: R
Hx: a <= x <= b

Goal:
SF_inf_fun f a b n x = match unif_part_nat a b n x Hx with | inleft H => Inf_fct f (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (proj1_sig H)) (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S (proj1_sig H))) | inright _ => Inf_fct f (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) n) (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S n)) end

Premises:
Inf_fct = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => if Req_EM_T a b then Finite 0 else Glb_Rbar (fun y : R => exists x : R, y = f x /\ Rmin a b < x < Rmax a b) : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
unif_part = fun (a b : R) (n : nat) => mkseq (fun i : nat => a + INR i * (b - a) / (INR n + 1)) (S (S n)) : R -> R -> nat -> seq R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope nat_scope]
proj1_sig : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
Inductive sumor (A : Type) (B : Prop) : Type := inleft : A -> A + {B} | inright : B -> A + {B} For inleft, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For inleft, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument A is implicit For inright, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For inright, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument B is implicit For sumor: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For inleft: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _] For inright: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
SF_inf_fun = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R) => if Rle_dec a b then SF_fun (SF_inf_seq f a b n) 0 x else SF_fun (SF_inf_seq f b a n) 0 x : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> nat -> R -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope nat_scope R_scope]
unif_part_nat : forall (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R), a <= x <= b -> {i : nat | nth 0 (unif_part a b n) i <= x < nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size (unif_part a b n))%nat} + {nth 0 (unif_part a b n) n <= x <= nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S n)}
SF_sup_fun_rw : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R) (Hx : a <= x <= b), SF_sup_fun f a b n x = match unif_part_nat a b n x Hx with | inleft H => Sup_fct f (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (proj1_sig H)) (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S (proj1_sig H))) | inright _ => Sup_fct f (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) n) (nth 0 (unif_part a b n) (S n)) end
SF_inf_ly : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat), SF_ly (SF_inf_seq f a b n) = behead (pairmap (Inf_fct f) 0 (unif_part a b n))
SF_sup_fun = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R) => if Rle_dec a b then SF_fun (SF_sup_seq f a b n) 0 x else SF_fun (SF_sup_seq f b a n) 0 x : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> nat -> R -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope nat_scope R_scope]
unif_part_sort : forall (a b : R) (n : nat), a <= b -> sorted Rle (unif_part a b n)
Inf_fct_bound : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R), Inf_fct f a b = Inf_fct f b a
SF_val_fun_rw : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R) (Hx : a <= x <= b), SF_val_fun f a b n x = match unif_part_nat a b n x Hx with | inleft H => f (a + (INR (proj1_sig H) + / 2) * (b - a) / (INR n + 1)) | inright _ => f (a + (INR n + / 2) * (b - a) / (INR n + 1)) end
head_unif_part : forall (x0 a b : R) (n : nat), head x0 (unif_part a b n) = a
last_unif_part : forall (x0 a b : R) (n : nat), last x0 (unif_part a b n) = b
SF_inf_fun_bound : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R), SF_inf_fun f a b n x = SF_inf_fun f b a n x
SF_fun_incr : forall (s : SF_seq) (y0 : ?T) (x0 : R) (Hs : sorted Rle (SF_lx s)) (Hx0 : head 0 (SF_lx s) <= x0 <= last 0 (SF_lx s)), SF_fun s y0 x0 = match sorted_dec (SF_lx s) 0 x0 Hs Hx0 with | inleft H => nth y0 (SF_ly s) (proj1_sig H) | inright _ => nth y0 (SF_ly s) (SF_size s - 1) end where ?T : [f : R -> R a : R b : R n : nat x : R Hx : a <= x <= b |- Type]
sorted_nth : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s : seq ?T), sorted Ord s < -> (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (size s))%nat -> forall x0 : ?T, Ord (nth x0 s i) (nth x0 s (S i))) where ?T : [f : R -> R a : R b : R n : nat x : R Hx : a <= x <= b |- Type]
Inf_fct_min : forall (f : R -> R) (a b m : R), (forall x : R, Rmin a b < x < Rmax a b -> m <= f x) -> is_finite (Inf_fct f a b)
Rminus_le_0 : forall a b : R, a <= b < -> 0 <= b - a
Sup_fct = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => if Req_EM_T a b then Finite 0 else Lub_Rbar (fun y : R => exists x : R, y = f x /\ Rmin a b < x < Rmax a b) : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Rbar Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Rle_div_l : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a / c <= b < -> a <= b * c
SF_inf_seq = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) (n : nat) => SF_seq_f2 (Inf_fct f) (unif_part a b n) : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> nat -> SF_seq Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope nat_scope]
interval_finite_subdiv : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal), a <= b -> {l : seq R | head 0 l = a /\ last 0 l = b /\ (forall i : nat, (S i < size l)%nat -> nth 0 l i < nth 0 l (S i) <= nth 0 l i + eps)}
Rminus_lt_0 : forall a b : R, a < b < -> 0 < b - a
Rlt_div_r : forall a b c : R, c > 0 -> a * c < b < -> a < b / c
SF_ly_f2 : forall (f2 : R -> R -> ?T) (P : seq R), SF_ly (SF_seq_f2 f2 P) = behead (pairmap f2 0 P) where ?T : [f : R -> R a : R b : R n : nat x : R Hx : a <= x <= b |- Type]
SF_val_fun = fun (T : Type) (f : R -> T) (a b : R) (n : nat) (x : R) => SF_fun_f2 (fun x0 y : R => f ((x0 + y) / 2)) (unif_part a b n) x : forall T : Type, (R -> T) -> R -> R -> nat -> R -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope nat_scope R_scope]
interval_finite_subdiv_between : forall (a b : R) (eps : posreal) (Hab : a <= b), let l := proj1_sig (interval_finite_subdiv a b eps Hab) in forall i : nat, (i < size l)%nat -> a <= nth 0 l i <= b
Rle_minus_l : forall a b c : R, a - c <= b < -> a <= b + c
SF_lx_cons : forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), SF_lx (SF_cons h s) = fst h :: SF_lx s where ?T : [f : R -> R a : R b : R n : nat x : R Hx : a <= x <= b |- Type]
Rlt_minus_r : forall a b c : R, a < b - c < -> a + c < b
SF_cons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [f : R -> R a : R b : R n : nat x : R Hx : a <= x <= b |- Type]
SF_cons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), P s -> P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [f : R -> R a : R b : R n : nat x : R Hx : a <= x <= b |- Type]
is_true = fun b : bool => b = true : bool -> Prop Argument scope is [bool_scope] is_true is a coercion
BinIntDef.Z.quotrem = fun a b : Z => match a with | 0%Z => (0%Z, 0%Z) | Z.pos a0 => match b with | 0%Z => (0%Z, a) | Z.pos b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in (BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) | Z.neg b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in ((- BinIntDef.Z.of_N q)%Z, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) end | Z.neg a0 => match b with | 0%Z => (0%Z, a) | Z.pos b0 => let (q, r) := N.pos_div_eucl a0 (N.pos b0) in...
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0%nat | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Argument scope is [N_scope]
